Package gw.plugin.security

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AuthenticationException  
    AuthenticationServicePlugin
    The authentication service plugin is used to authorize a user from AuthenticationSource data. It is up to the implementation how to do this; however, the following contract must be observed. The service must handle the UserNamePasswordAuthenticationSource class. This class contains a username and password combination. By obeying this rule, all external services will be able to authenticate using a username and password. All modifications to the user record must be done using the AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler object. This callback allows you to query for the user, modify the user, and modify relationships of the user (such as its role or group.).
    AuthenticationServicePluginCallbackHandler  
    AuthenticationSource  
    AuthenticationSource.Failure  
    AuthenticationSourceCallback  
    AuthenticationSourceCreatorPlugin
    This plugin is responsible for creating an AuthenticationSource from an HTTPRequest object. The authentication source must be usable by the AuthenticationServicePlugin defined in the plugin config.
    CredentialVerificationResult  
    InactiveUserException  
    InvalidAuthenticationSourceData  
    LockedCredentialException  
    MustWaitToRetryException  
    UserNamePasswordAuthenticationSource  
    UserValueNVP  
    WebservicesAuthenticationContext  
    WebservicesAuthenticationPlugin
    This plugin is responsible for authenticating WSI webservice requests.
